page.title: 11HOPES & FEARS,DRAYTON AREA
page.content: When interviewed,the main hope expressed by people in the village was that{Drayton}should maintain its identity and not become engulfed by the new development,linking several areas into one{homogenous suburb}of {Norwich. Locally,a{dispute}has recently arisen between the{Church}and the {Parish Council}over a proposed extension to the Church,providing a Sunday school and a meeting room. Objections are against the moving of graves and the lack of available parking space. Another bone of contention is the {division of the village}by the Fakenham road,which has split the village into two halves,the green and the old village being isolated from the new developments,and the village losing much of its former cohesion.
